 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּרְמִיל‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==crimson, carmine==, i.e. crimson stuff, cloth; late (probably Persian loan-word, and a derive. from Persian <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***worm***, see [[BDB#De|De]]<sup>ZDuth. Th. 1878, 593</sup>); — only [[2Chr.2.6|2Chr 2:6]]; [[2Chr.2.13|2Chr 2:13]]; [[2Chr.3.14|2Chr 3:14]] (in all + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַרְגָּמָן (ו־ָןׅ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּכֵלֶת‎</span> [[2Chr.2.13|2Chr 2:13]]; [[2Chr.3.14|2Chr 3:14]] + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בּוּץ‎</span> also ); read perhaps also for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּדְמֶל‎</span> [[Song.7.6|Song 7:6]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַרְגָּוָן‎</span>: so [[BDB#Gi|Gi]], of hair formed spirally, like shell-fish; [[BDB#Gr|Gr]], of glossy hair).
